div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE NINTH CIRCUIT, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF L.J. URANN FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.} PETITION FOR APPEAL.
And now comes the above named petitioner and respectfully represents to the court:
I.

That he is advised and verily believes that the matter of his petition and the ruling thereon presents a fair question of law and fact for appeal; that he is entitled upon his petition to have tried to a conclusion, upon all questions of fact, the right and regularity of his detention; and that he has a right to an inquiry, trial and decision in the asylum State, of all questions of fact or law which go to the right of any State or Sovereignty, to remove him therefrom, that such right is an absolute right and triable at all times in the courts of his selected residence.
II.

That he desires to appeal to the Circuit Court of Appeals to have determined his right to such trial upon the fact and to have determined his right to remain in the asylum State and all other questions of law raised by the record.
III.
That he makes this petition in good faith and for the purpose of prosecuting his appeal without delay.
WHEREFORE Your petitioner prays that he be allowed appeal in the due course of law.
Vince H. Faben Attorney for Petitioner.
State of Washington County of King.}ss

L.H. Urann being first duly sworn on oath deposes and says: That he is petitioner in the above entitled action; that he has read the foregoing Petition for Appeal and knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true.
Louis J Urann
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 5th day of July, 1905.
Vince H. Faben Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
/TF/
ORIGINAL.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE NINTH CIRCUIT?, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF L.J. URANN FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Jul 5 1905 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk A. N. Moor Dep.
PETITION FOR APPEAL.
Vince H. Faben, 504 Mutual Life Bldg., Seattle, Washington.
